SENT.plain: Intraparenchymal hemorrhage in the full-term neonate rarely occurs more than 2 weeks after birth, and its definitive cause remains unclear
In the present report, a case of a patient with intraparenchymal hemorrhage occurring 33 days after birth is described
Histological examination of the brain tissue obtained during hematoma evacuation through craniotomy showed hemorrhagic infarction
Patent foramen ovale may have been present and this may have led to spontaneous paradoxical cerebral embolism followed by hemorrhagic infarction
